publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-116# Brian Adam: Aberdeen Council Housing Debt Write-Offâ€”That the Parliament notes the Treasury-led write-off of Glasgow City Council's housing debt; regrets the linking of that action to the wholesale transfer of the council's housing stock; applauds the overwhelming rejection of such a wholesale stock transfer by Aberdeen City Council's tenants, and expects that a similar debt write-off will be made to benefit Aberdeen City Council's housing tenants and to allow the council to invest more in its stock. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-116# Aberdeen Council Housing Debt Write-Off (lodged on 6 June 2003) Stewart Stevenson*
S2M-116# Aberdeen Council Housing Debt Write-Off (lodged on 6 June 2003) Christine Grahame*, Michael Matheson*, Alex Neil*, Ms Sandra White*

S2M-116# Aberdeen Council Housing Debt Write-Off (lodged on 6 June 2003) Roseanna Cunningham*, Chris Ballance*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Mr Rob Gibson*, Fiona Hyslop*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Carolyn Leckie*, Shiona Baird*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-116# Aberdeen Council Housing Debt Write-Off (lodged on 6 June 2003) Elaine Smith*
S2M-116# Aberdeen Council Housing Debt Write-Off (lodged on 6 June 2003) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
S2M-116# Aberdeen Council Housing Debt Write-Off (lodged on 6 June 2003) John Swinburne*
